text: This bottled Sake from a bottle shop poured a head of frothy finely sized clear colored bubbles that were very quickly diminishing and left behind a strong bubbly carbonation transparent weak straw yellow colored body. The nice aroma was peach and floral. The bubbly mouth feel was strongly tingly at the start and weakly tingly at the finish with a bubbly fruity aftertaste. The nice flavor contained notes of rice and peach. A decent one that I would consider drinking again.

Bottle 250ml. [ As Ozeki (Japan) Hana Fuga (Sparkling Empress) Sake ].Clear crystal water color with virtually no head. Aroma is moderate to heavy rice, perfume, peach. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet with a long duration, peach, apricot, sweet candy. Body is medium, texture is watery and sticky, carbonation is flat. [20150730]

Bottle shared at chrisos Easter 2015 tasting - London. Pours clear, pale white. Juicy peach in the nose. Tastes light sugary peach yoghurt - not a bad thing, all in all. Medium bodied, soft. Sugary finish, with lightly sticky sweetness, more peach yoghurt. Very tasty.

Bottle split at Chriso Easter Tasting 15, 04/04/15. 
Translucent washed through white with nothing in the way of a covering.
Nose is sweet, peach notes, light plum and grape, apricot.
Taste comprises sweet peaches, apricot, melon balls, white grapes, sweet licks.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, sweet close.
Ok.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Bottle at a tasting at Chris and Ruth 150404. No color, no head. Peach aroma, bready, fruity, bready. Peach flavor, alcohol, raisins, bread.
Bottle at Craigs. Pours clear, light pink hue. Light sparkle. Aromas are sweet peachy. Taste is cloying.
Bottle at craigs. Pours clear pale golden, nose is fruity peach, floral, taste is similar, dry.

Plain clearish body with visible carbonation aids a bubbly ringed head. Very sweet peach liqueur nose and creamy boiled sweet booziness. Rich, soapy sweet peach schnapps and a trickle of that carbonation. Finishes itchy sweet and sedate ricey. Not rough raking sake but everything is a bit one sided sweet. Bottle, Japan Centre, Belgcomedown Tasting

UPDATED: APR 1, 2015 bottle at home ... clear ... thin white lacing ...massive pineapple peach nose ... sof sharp fruit ... zezty pineapple .. light apple.. light bitter ... long raw alcohol linger ... biter peach fruits
Definitely the worst sake so far as this one is more or less just peach juice with a hint of ricewater. Drinkable, but way to sweet and the finish is more than non-pleasing.

Pours out of the bottle in a vanilla-peachy colour with smooth body. Nice aroma of peaches and flowers. Taste of peach juice and flowers but it also has its sake moments when you taste the basmati rice and sweet alcohol. Propably the worst sake I had until now but nice anyway. Just too sweet, too girly.
